intro: Centaurea scabiosa proles calcarea, commonly known as the limestone cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. This species is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, contributing to its ecological and ornamental value.
